quoteLast: My hand grasped the handle of the camera. I set my teeth. My whole mind was concentrated upon my work. Another thirty seconds passed.
title:
How I Filmed the War
A Record of the Extraordinary Experiences of the Man Who Filmed the Great Somme Battles, etc.
author: Malins, Geoffrey H.; Warren, Low, -1941 [Editor]

quoteFirst: Ah, it's too late! . . . I should so much have liked. . . . Patrice. . . . Coralie. . . .' There's what I heard, sir, and here are the two facts which we cannot escape. This morning, at
quoteLast: , a man was murdered having upon him an amethyst pendant. This is the first undeniable fact. A few hours later, at twenty-three minutes past twelve, this same amethyst pendant is discovered clutched in the hand of another man.
title: The Golden Triangle: The Return of Arsène Lupin
author: Leblanc, Maurice, 1864-1941

quoteFirst: He stood utterly dumfounded. His eyes had fastened on a large clock which he saw, through the window, on one of the buildings in the yard, marking
quoteLast: ; and he mechanically repeated these figures, attributing a documentary value to them. Then he asked himself--so unreal did the scene appear to him--if all this was true and if the crime had not been penetrated within himself, in the depths of his aching heart.
title: The Golden Triangle: The Return of Arsène Lupin
author: Leblanc, Maurice, 1864-1941

title: The Golden Triangle: The Return of Arsène Lupin

quoteFirst: "Yes, it was he. That was at
quoteTime: nineteen minutes past seven in the morning
quoteLast: , as you noted. A few minutes later, eager to know and understand, you yourself rang up; and it was Essarès who replied, with your father's dead body at his feet."

quoteFirst: But the struggle was not finished; and its dying agony has been a most shocking tragedy. According to your statement, a man who knew you and who was seeking to get into touch with you, was killed at
quoteLast: , most likely by Essarès Bey, who dreaded his intervention. And, five hours later, at twenty-three past twelve, Essarès Bey himself was murdered, presumably by one of his accomplices. There is the whole story, Captain Belval.
title: The Golden Triangle: The Return of Arsène Lupin
author: Leblanc, Maurice, 1864-1941
